description:
We're looking for a Senior Full Stack AI Engineer to build a social automation tool powered by LLMs. The platform will intelligently automate client responses and streamline communication workflows. If you're experienced in FastAPI, Next.js, and TypeScript, and have hands-on experience deploying LLM-powered features, this project is for you.

**What You’ll Build**
- A modern, full-stack web app using FastAPI and Next.js
- Smart backend pipelines that integrate OpenAI, Claude, or Hugging Face models
- LLM-powered automation workflows to handle client communication at scale
- A clean, responsive frontend that feels fast and intuitive
- Scalable infrastructure for production-grade deployment

**Who You Are**
You’re a seasoned AI/ML Full Stack Engineer with 8+ years of experience delivering full products—not just writing isolated features. You’ve built custom AI agents, RAG-based assistants, and multi-agent frameworks, and you know how to architect web apps for performance, clarity, and scale.

**Your Responsibilities**
- Develop a robust FastAPI backend, integrating LLMs for intelligent automation
- Build the frontend in Next.js (App Router) and TypeScript, styled with Tailwind CSS/ShadCN
- Connect third-party APIs and manage authentication, user workflows, and secure data
- Design clean, maintainable systems with a strong emphasis on code quality and scalability
- Deploy and maintain the application on Vercel, Supabase, or AWS
- Collaborate async and deliver regular progress updates

**Project Scope**
- Build a production-ready AI social automation tool for handling client interactions
- Leverage LLM + RAG pipelines to make responses context-aware
- Timeline: ~3–4 months for MVP delivery, with the option for ongoing feature expansion
- Prioritize speed, reliability, and clean architecture from day one

Submit your portfolio and relevant project examples. In your message, tell us how you've previously used LLMs, FastAPI, and Next.js to build complete AI-powered applications. We’d love to hear your technical thoughts on how you’d approach building this tool.
title: AI-Focused Full Stack Developer (FastAPI, Next.js, TypeScript) – LLM Automation Platform

description:
Website Migration and Redesign from ModeX to WordPress

Project Overview
We are seeking a comprehensive technical and strategic proposal for the migration, redesign, and replatforming of a magazine website from its current ModX platform to a modern, secure, and high-performing WordPress-based solution. The project must ensure operational continuity, deliver a significantly improved user experience, and support full integration with existing marketing and CRM tools such as HubSpot.

Key aspects of the project include: Complete website redesign focused on modern visual language, accessibility, and responsiveness. Migration of content and structure with SEO and performance improvements. Integration with HubSpot and marketing tools, setup of a secure and enhanced members’ area with personalised content access and user-level control.

Interested parties should submit a detailed proposal that includes a complete breakdown of project phases, deliverables, timelines, and associated costs.

Project Deliverables:

UX/UI design on Figma
A preliminary design phase where you create high-fidelity layouts and mockups to align on structure, branding, and user experience before development begins.
Creation of visual layouts and interactive mockups before development
Collaborative review and approval process with us

 WordPress Base Setup
Installation and configuration of the WordPress environment
Installation of the graphical theme (to be selected by us, with your consultancy and guidance)
Basic configuration for security, performance, and scheduled backups
Page Builder Integration (Elementor)
Ensures efficient layout design with full responsiveness and flexible editing
Optimise for performance and future scalability


HubSpot Integration
Connection of the website to HubSpot CRM
Configuration to receive order confirmations and contact form submissions directly into HubSpot

WooCommerce Configuration
Installation and setup of the WooCommerce plugin for e-commerce
Customisation of purchase flows according to our business logic
Integration with product catalog and order confirmation emails
Payment Module Configuration via HubSpot
Integration of payment systems (Stripe) through HubSpot
End-to-end functional testing and validation of payment flow

Members’ Area
Setup of a restricted area accessible only to registered users
Configuration of user roles and permission levels
Management of protected content and exclusive documents

PDF Reader Plugin
Installation and configuration of a plugin for online PDF reading in flipbook style
Optimised display on both desktop and mobile devices

Content Migration & Creation

Manual creation of 8 static pages (using text and images from the current website)
Manual migration of 180 articles/posts (including titles, text, images, metadata)

Basic SEO On-Page Optimisation
Custom meta titles and descriptions for all pages and articles
Optimisation of heading tags (H1–H6), images (alt attributes), and clean URL structures
Ensuring best practices in SEO layout and content hierarchy

Redirect Management
Manual creation of ~200 redirects for non-replicated URLs from the current website
Ensures SEO integrity and a smooth user experience during and after migration
GDPR Compliance
Setup of privacy tools and cookie banner (integrated with Consent Management tools)
Use of GDPR-compliant plugins and configurations aligned with European data protection standards

Testing and Go-Live
Complete functionality and usability testing across browsers and devices
Final adjustments and go-live support with direct monitoring and assistance

description:
Build a Legal AI RAG Prototype on Azure Government

⸻

Project overview
We need a secure, citation-aware Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) prototype that runs entirely inside an Azure Government tenant. The prototype will let attorneys chat with a corpus of federal regulations (FAR, DFARS, HIPAA, standard contract language) and receive grounded answers with inline citations. A lightweight web UI and a clean backend API are required.

⸻

Expected deliverables
	1.	Azure Government environment configured by code (Terraform or Bicep) with VNet isolation, Key Vault, Azure AI Search, and Azure OpenAI resources.
	2.	Data-prep pipeline that ingests legal PDFs, parses, chunks, embeds, and indexes them in Azure AI Search.
	3.	Backend service (FastAPI, Flask, or .NET minimal API) that performs the RAG workflow and streams responses.
	4.	Front-end MVP: a single-page React or plain HTML/JS chat interface with source links and basic 508 compliance.
	5.	DevSecOps setup: CI/CD pipeline, container scanning, SBOM, logging, and minimal RMF control mapping for a future Authority to Operate.
	6.	Handoff package: architecture diagram, runbook, recorded walkthrough, and all code in a private Git repository.

⸻

Key skills

Azure Government, Azure OpenAI, Azure AI Search, Vector Search, Terraform, Bicep, Azure DevOps, Python, LangChain, FastAPI, .NET 6, React, OAuth2, Azure AD, DevSecOps, FedRAMP, NIST RMF, Prompt Engineering, Legal NLP.

⸻

Communication
	•	Kick-off video call to confirm scope and grant access.
	•	Daily async status updates in Slack or Teams with responses within one business day.
	•	Weekly fifteen-minute demo or screen-share.
	•	Issues tracked in GitHub Projects; pull requests reviewed before merge.

⸻

Working style
	•	Iterative, test-driven development with small, reviewable commits.
	•	Security first: no public endpoints, secrets in Key Vault.
	•	Documentation produced alongside code (inline comments, markdown in /docs, short Loom clips).
	•	You can overlap at least two hours with US-Eastern time but otherwise set your own schedule.

⸻

What to include in your proposal
	•	Brief description of similar Azure Government or RAG projects you have delivered.
	•	Confirmation that you can provision resources in Gov regions or an explanation of your approach if you lack direct access.
	•	Estimated timeline and budget for the six deliverables above.
	•	A link to a code sample or demo that shows your proficiency (redact confidential details as needed).

We respond to qualified proposals within forty-eight hours and are ready to start as soon as we find the right fit.
title: Building RAG using Azure Government

description:
Company Overview:
Good Face is a formulation, regulatory compliance, and innovation software used by hundreds of leading
cosmetic companies to make safe, compliant, transparent, and effective products.
Our innovative solution cuts tedious work out of the product development and R&D cycle, enabling
formulators to focus instead on product innovation and business growth. We are seeking a highly
motivated QA Engineer to join our dynamic Engineering team and contribute to our continued success.
We are an ambitious, talented, and most importantly, fun team, with the common goal of bringing game-
changing technology to the beauty industry and enabling cosmetic chemistry innovators to build better
beauty. Does collaboration, customer centricity, and relentless innovation sound like your workplace
trifecta?

Position Overview: 
As a QA Engineer, you will play a key role in delivering a bug-free, scalable SaaS product to hundreds of
customers and thousands of users. You will be responsible for working together with the broader QA
team to document expected system behavior, create QA scenarios, and test the product extensively as a
part of every sprint. By leveraging your excellent communication skills, you will create a collaborative
Engineering team environment, which will enable the delivery of excellent new and evolved product
features while promoting team understanding of the overall product.

What you’ll bring to the team:
● 3+ years of experience in QA.
● Strong experience in manual testing, not just UI, but also logic-heavy areas – e.g., analytical
report generation, complex flows, etc.
● Solid understanding of API testing, and hands-on experience with Postman or similar tools.
● Proficiency with Atlassian JIRA/Confluence, including the ability to write clear and detailed
tickets and test plans.
● Familiarity with Chrome Developer Tools.
● Bonus if you have tested projects with Python backend and React frontend.
● Fluent spoken and written English is a must.
● Ukrainian language is a plus, as our dev team is fully Ukrainian-speaking and daily standups are
currently in Ukrainian. However, we are expanding the team, and will switch languages if needed.
● Experience working with scientific or regulatory datasets, a plus.

description:
AI Systems Engineer Generalist — Contract-to-Hire

We’re a two-person AI consultancy that lives for hard problems and fast wins. We “vibe-code” with Claude Code today, but we need a real engineer who loves building (not just integrating) large-language-model tech and can push our tooling, automations, and client deliverables to the next level.

We’re not looking for someone who just wires up APIs or wraps OpenAI calls in a Flask app. We want a **deeply AI-enabled coder**—someone who codes *with* models as a co-pilot, experiments with agentic workflows, uses AI to refactor and reason, and constantly pushes the frontier on what’s possible with model-assisted development. You should be opinionated about your stack, excited by new tooling, and able to tell us what you’re using today, what’s missing, and what you wish you had.

This role will be hired and paid through Upwork. 
Start as an hourly contract; grow into our go-to engineering partner if we both love the fit.

What You’ll Own
- Architect and ship production-grade LLM pipelines (chat, RAG, multi-agent, fine-tuning)
- Wrangle data and infra: chunking, embeddings, vector DBs, GPU and CPU scaling, CI and CD, monitoring
- Prototype new workflows fast—then harden them for client deployments
- Stay bleeding-edge: scout 2025’s newest models, frameworks, and ops tools and bring the best ideas back
- Level us up: teach two technical founders better engineering discipline and automate yourself out of repetitive tasks

Must-Haves
- Proven LLM experience: you’ve built and shipped at least one serious LLM or RAG system in production—be ready to walk us through the architecture
- Fluent coder: Python first; TypeScript, Go, or Rust a plus. Clean code, tests, and Git workflow are table stakes
- Infra literacy: Docker, Kubernetes or serverless runtimes; vector stores (Pinecone, Weaviate, Qdrant, pgvector); vLLM or TensorRT-LLM or equivalent for fast inference
- System thinker: you balance latency, cost, and accuracy, and have strong opinions on prompt vs retrieval vs fine-tune trade-offs
- AI-native developer mindset: you treat models as tools in your coding toolbox, not just services you call

Nice-to-Haves
- Modal, Ray, or RunPod experience for elastic GPU workloads
- Front-end comfort (React or Nextjs) to wire up quick demos
- Data ops and fine-tune tooling: Kubeflow, BentoML, LoRA, PEFT
- Prior consulting or startup experience where you juggled ambiguity and many hats

How We Work
- 100 percent remote, async-first, lightweight meetings
- Ship iterative, testable slices—no months-long stealth builds

How to Apply
In your proposal, include exactly three sections — nothing more, nothing less:

1. 200 words or less on why you’re obsessed with AI-first engineering. Be specific about how you use AI to code, what tools you rely on daily, and what AI capabilities you wish existed.
2. A link to one LLM or RAG project you built (repo or deep technical write-up)
3. One paragraph on the most exciting 2025 tool or technique you’d use to 10x our workflow efficiency — and how

If your experience is real and your ideas are fresh, we’ll move fast. Show us what you’ve built, not just what you’ve read.

description:
Overview
Phoenix Industrial Redevelopment, LLC (PIR) is requesting proposals from qualified backend developers with specific experience integrating with Morningstar ByAllAccounts. The objective is to build a backend integration that enables visibility of PIR fund allocations in WealthTech platforms (e.g., Advyzon, Tamarac, Orion) that aggregate account data through ByAllAccounts.

This integration will support PIR’s growing relationships with Series 66 Wealth Managers and RIAs, ensuring that client allocations into PIR-managed syndications and funds (via InvestNext) are correctly reflected in the advisor's dashboard.

About PIR
Phoenix Industrial Redevelopment (PIR) is a national leader in small-bay industrial real estate. Through our Workspace Nation® portfolio and proprietary programs (FixedFunds®, 1031Funds®), we enable accredited investors to participate in the resurgence of U.S. manufacturing by investing in value-add industrial parks across the country.

We serve both direct investors and financial advisors allocating capital on behalf of clients—and this integration is a critical step in deepening our support of the latter.

Project Scope
We seek a backend specialist to:

1. Design and Implement Integration
Develop a secure backend API service or bridge that:

Connects InvestNext data (via API or flat file) with ByAllAccounts (via API or custom feed specification)

Transmits allocation and performance data for each advisor’s client investment into PIR products

Supports account mapping and data standardization per ByAllAccounts/WealthTech system requirements

2. Ensure WealthTech Visibility
Confirm that allocations appear in downstream platforms such as Advyzon, Tamarac, or Orion

Collaborate with ByAllAccounts technical team (and PIR’s internal team) to test and certify visibility

3. Ensure Security and Compliance
Implement secure authentication (OAuth or equivalent)

Encrypt all transmitted data

Ensure solution is compliant with data handling requirements relevant to investment platforms and financial advisors

4. Provide Documentation and Support
Deliver full API documentation and data mapping structure

Provide guidance to PIR on ongoing maintenance or changes required for platform updates

Optional: post-implementation support agreement

Deliverables
Functional backend integration with ByAllAccounts

Successful data flow validated in one or more WealthTech platforms

Documentation (API design, error handling, data schema, mapping rules)

Optional: SLA proposal for maintenance

Preferred Qualifications
Proven experience developing integrations with Morningstar ByAllAccounts (REQUIRED)

Experience integrating investment platforms (InvestNext, Juniper Square, or similar)

Proficient in secure RESTful API design, webhooks, data synchronization, and encryption protocols

Strong grasp of financial data aggregation, wealth management tech stack, and regulatory data considerations (SEC/FINRA, Reg D familiarity helpful)

Proposal Requirements
Interested parties must submit a proposal including the following:

Company/Individual Overview

Relevant experience

Team bios (if applicable)

Project Approach

Technical architecture overview

Integration and testing plan

Timeline and milestones

Portfolio or Case Studies

Examples of similar integrations (especially ByAllAccounts or WealthTech)

Pricing

Fixed fee or milestone-based budget proposal

Optional support/maintenance rates

References

At least one reference from a related integration project
title: API Integration Developer – InvestNext to Morningstar ByAllAccounts for WealthTech Visibility

description:
Automate Jotform-to-AWS MySQL Data Transfer via Zapier & Build Admin Panel Web UI

**Project Objective:**
Streamline and automate the transfer of form submissions from Jotforms to an AWS-hosted MySQL database using Zapier, and create a secure web-based admin panel to visualize and manage the data.

**Scope of Work:**

**Zapier Integration:**

* Configure Zapier to automate the transfer of data from Jotforms to AWS MySQL.
* Ensure reliable, real-time synchronization of form submissions.

**Database Optimization:**

* Design and optimize a scalable MySQL database schema to efficiently manage incoming data.
* Implement indexing and performance tuning as needed.

**Automation Testing:**

* Perform end-to-end testing of the automation workflow to ensure data integrity and operational reliability.

**Admin Panel Development:**

* Build a responsive and user-friendly web-based admin panel for internal staff.
* Include features such as data filtering, sorting, and search functionality for efficient data handling.

**Technical Requirements:**

* Secure integration between Jotforms, Zapier, and AWS MySQL with encryption and access controls.
* Adhere to best practices for data security and system reliability.
* Ensure the admin panel is cross-browser compatible and mobile-responsive.

**Deliverables:**

* Fully functional and secure Zapier automation pipeline from Jotforms to AWS MySQL.
* Optimized and production-ready MySQL database.
* A modern admin panel with robust data management tools.
* Comprehensive documentation for system configuration, usage, and maintenance.

**Required Skills:**

description:
We are looking for some help optimizing our website. We are envision the project in 3 phases: a comprehensive technical audit, implementation of changes where needed, and finally changes to UX/UI and keyword development when we can provide an updated list of ideal customers, our services, and conversion goals at the end. If you are interested and available in helping us with this project, I'd love to discuss further.

We have a Wordpress website that was built using Divi, and hosted using LiquidWeb, Cloudflare, and Web Host Management with Apache. We'd like a thorough front to back end audit that includes:
- On-page and Page-level SEO improvements
- Technical SEO audit (not competitor or location based right now, just current standing)
- Backlink and link structure audit
- Page speed and Core Web Vitals analysis
- Plugin and theme performance audits (Divi-specific experience preferred)
- JavaScript and code efficiency audit
- Hosting and CDN setup review
- Any plugin issues
-Open to other areas you deem appropriate to investigate.

This will be our foundation before moving forward to the next phases. We'd also like help implementing any of the changes found in the audit if needed.

After getting the website in shape after the audit and making adjustments where needed, we'd provide you with more information on our services, competitors, and ideal customer base. With this information, we'd like help in UX/UI design with conversion goals in mind from our customer profiles, clarifying our messaging around the services we offer, optimizing the layout of the website, and finally keyword research and development with our services and customer base in mind.

REQURIED INFO:
- Anticipated timeframe for a comprehensive website audit?
- What is your rate?
- Will you bill as you complete a certain amount of hours or a flat rate at the completion of the project/or phases?
- Do you have experience in the applications and areas we're requesting help with?
- What applications and tools will you use to complete this project?
- What access do you need from our end to complete the audit?
- Do you have any examples of an audit package you could provide?

description:
📄 Task Summary:

We’re looking for a skilled developer to implement a feature where AI reads and extracts structured data from uploaded files (images, PDFs, or Excel files) and uses this information to auto-fill a table in Flutter Web. Backend support will be handled with Laravel.

This is a task-based collaboration, and this specific task will require expertise in AI/machine learning, Flutter Web, and Laravel API development.

⸻

💼 What We Offer:

✅ Flexible work – Pick tasks that match your skillset
✅ Clear scopes – Each task is well defined
✅ Performance-based pay – Paid after successful completion
✅ Modern tools – GitHub Actions CI/CD, HestiaCP, DigitalOcean
✅ UI-first development – All designs are in Figma

⸻

🛠️ Your Role:

You’ll be responsible for:
	•	Integrating AI-based file parsing (image OCR, PDF text extraction, Excel parsing)
	•	Structuring and sending extracted data to a Flutter Web table
	•	Handling file uploads and processing logic via Laravel backend
	•	Collaborating asynchronously via GitHub and task tickets

⸻

👨‍💻 Tech We Use:

Backend – Laravel 9, PHP 8
	•	Sanctum for auth, Pusher for real-time, DOMPDF for PDF gen, QR code tools
	•	GitHub Actions for CI/CD, deployed to DigitalOcean via HestiaCP

Frontend – Flutter Web
	•	auto_route, freezed, build_runner, drop_zone, google_maps_flutter
	•	flutter_image_compress, pointer_interceptor, custom UI components

⸻

🎯 What We’re Looking For:
	•	Strong experience with AI/ML integrations (e.g., OCR, document parsing, data extraction)
	•	Solid knowledge of Laravel API development and handling file uploads/processing
	•	Proficiency in Flutter Web, especially for displaying and manipulating dynamic tables
	•	Familiarity with asynchronous work and GitHub workflows

⸻

✅ Bonus Points:
	•	Experience with tools like Tesseract OCR, OpenAI, LangChain, or PaddleOCR
	•	Working with Excel parsers in Laravel (e.g., PhpSpreadsheet, Laravel-Excel)
	•	Handling AI output parsing and error management
	•	Knowledge of file security, validation, and real-time progress updates

⸻

✉️ How to Apply

Send us a short message with:
	1.	Your experience using AI or ML in real-world projects
	2.	Your experience with Laravel file processing and Flutter Web
	3.	Examples of similar features you’ve built (especially file parsing or dynamic UI generation)

Let us know why this task fits your skillset — we’re excited to collaborate!

⸻

🧩 Ready to turn complex files into clean, structured data? Join us on this AI-powered journey!

description:
Job Description:
We’re looking for a skilled Node.js developer with experience working with the Google Drive API to help us complete a server-side integration for our trading platform.

We previously had the integration working on localhost, but have now migrated everything into a new subdomain (drive.fxnotes.com) for better separation of concerns. Since moving the project files into this new folder structure on the server, we need help getting everything running smoothly again in production.

What We’re Trying to Do:
The API should:

Accept a GET request like /drive/:email

Use our Google Service Account credentials to:

Look up a user's folder inside a predefined root folder (we provide the root folder ID)

Traverse the following structure:

Root folder ➝ User folder (email) ➝ Pairs folder ➝ Subfolders (each representing an asset)

Return a list of all .webm video files inside each asset folder with metadata (file ID, name, date, link, asset name)

All of this was tested and working locally via Node.js/Express.

What We Need Help With Now:
Ensuring the Google Drive integration runs correctly on our production server

Troubleshooting why the API is not responding after deployment

Making sure it reads the .env file for the ROOT_FOLDER_ID and accesses service-account.json securely

Ensuring the API runs cleanly using PM2, listens on the right port (e.g. 3000 or 4000), and is exposed correctly via drive.fxnotes.com

Setting appropriate access permissions so the Drive API can function in the cPanel/WHM environment

Returning accurate JSON responses with video metadata as described above

Environment:
Server uses WHM/cPanel, with SSH access (non-root user)

PM2 manages the Node.js process

Node.js version: 18

Google Drive credentials (JSON key + root folder ID) already configured

service-account.json, drive.js, and index.js all set up — just need connecting properly in deployment

.env file holds the root folder ID

New subdomain drive.fxnotes.com is pointed to the correct folder on the server

Deliverables:
Drive API endpoint fully working on drive.fxnotes.com

Able to return all .webm files for a user by email

Fully functioning via server, not just localhost

PM2 process running without errors

Provide short documentation on what was fixed (optional but appreciated)

Ideal Candidate:
Strong Node.js & Express experience

Solid understanding of Google APIs (especially Drive)

Comfortable working in Linux/cPanel environments

Experience troubleshooting deployments using PM2 and nginx proxy setups

We already have another API live on api.fxnotes.com, so you’ll be working alongside that architecture.

This is a standalone integration but more backend work is available if successful.

openJobs.title: Fix & Finalise User Signup/Login API for Node.js App on cPanel Server

title: Finalise Google Drive API Integration for Web App (Node.js + Express)

description:
We're seeking a reliable and experienced Node.js backend developer to help us complete and properly deploy a simple user signup/login system for our trading platform's web app.

The functionality is already built and works perfectly in our local environment. The problem lies in deploying it to production.

What We Need:
Fix the deployment of an existing server.js file that:

Accepts POST requests for /api/signup and /api/login

Reads/writes user data to a local users.json file

Ensure that when a user signs up via POST /api/signup, their details are saved to users.json

Ensure that login requests via POST /api/login are correctly validated

Confirm everything is working properly via cURL or Postman

Ensure the .json file writes to the correct directory on our live server (cPanel/WHM environment using PM2 and Node.js v18)

Environment Details:
Hosting provider uses WHM/cPanel with SSH root access

We are using PM2 to manage the Node process

App runs on port 3000, exposed via a subdomain (api.fxnotes.com)

You’ll have:

Access to the server (non-root user)

All the working project files: server.js, users.json, package.json, etc.

Deliverables:
Sign-up and login endpoints should fully work on the live server

New users should be written to the users.json file on the correct path

Provide a short walkthrough or documentation of what was fixed (optional but appreciated)

Ideal Candidate:
Strong experience with Node.js, file I/O, and Express

Comfortable working with Linux servers (especially with cPanel/PM2 setups)

Able to troubleshoot quickly and communicate clearly

This is a small and focused job, but we have follow-up work ready (e.g. Google Drive API integration), so successful delivery could lead to more opportunities immediately after.

description:
Job Summary:
We are seeking an experienced and motivated AI Agent Developer to lead the design, development, and deployment of intelligent agents integrated within Microsoft Teams, with a focus on automating business workflows and enabling natural language interaction. This role also requires a strong understanding of Search Engine Optimization (SEO)—especially as it relates to content generation, semantic search, and discoverability of AI-generated responses.

The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in building production-ready bots using Microsoft Bot Framework, Azure Cognitive Services, and integrating SEO principles into enterprise AI solutions.

Key Responsibilities:
AI Agent & Chatbot Development
Design, build, and maintain AI agents and chatbots for Microsoft Teams using Bot Framework SDK and Microsoft Bot Composer.

Integrate with backend systems like SAP, ServiceNow, SharePoint, and Azure APIs.

Implement intelligent dialog flows using LUIS/QnA Maker/Conversational Language Understanding or OpenAI/GPT-based models.

Create scalable agent orchestration logic that includes handoff to human agents and multi-turn conversations.

Enable AI agent capabilities such as summarization, classification, ranking, and workflow triggers.

Microsoft Teams Integration
Build rich adaptive cards, messaging extensions, and actionable chat features within the Teams environment.

Handle authentication, role-based access, and compliance within Teams apps.

Deploy and maintain Teams apps via Azure App Service or other deployment pipelines.

SEO and Search Experience
Implement semantic search and SEO-aware content generation capabilities within AI agents.

Optimize AI-generated responses for visibility and indexing on enterprise portals or public-facing websites.

Work with vector databases (e.g., Azure AI Search, Elasticsearch, Pinecone) to enable semantic enrichment.

Structure metadata and output in line with schema.org and search engine best practices.

description:
PHP / Laravel + Livewire Developer (4-Week Contract)
Location: Remote
Commitment: Full-time, Contract (4 weeks)
Start Date: Immediate
Overview
We’re hiring an experienced PHP / Laravel developer to join our engineering team for a short-term, full-time contract. You will be working on a high-impact internal SaaS portal that leverages Livewire (v3) and Laravel to deliver powerful, dynamic UI components for AI agent workflows.
This role is ideal for someone who has delivered commercial-grade Laravel/Livewire applications, has a strong grasp of modern Laravel architecture, and is comfortable working autonomously in a focused sprint.
Key Responsibilities
Develop and extend Livewire v3 UI components in an existing Laravel project.


Write clean, maintainable, class-based components (not Volt).


Integrate with API endpoints using Saloon and Bearer token authentication.


Implement configuration options for authentication (.env-based) and access controls (e.g., allow-listing by IP/domain).


Use Laravel migrations to manage and evolve database schemas.


Handle complex database transformations, particularly for EAV-style schemas.


Write automated tests using PestPHP (or PHPUnit where necessary).


Ensure views are componentised for reuse, including generating shareable view-only pages.


Follow action-based patterns for external API communication.


Tech Stack & Tools
Must-Have Experience With:
PHP 8.x+


Laravel (Recent versions)


Livewire (V3)


Laravel Migrations


Saloon (API communication)


Component-based front-end logic using Blade and Livewire


Writing tests using PestPHP (or PHPUnit)


Working with relational databases and EAV table structures


Bearer token-based authentication


Building features on top of an existing, deployed Laravel app (hosted on Heroku)


Nice to Have:
Familiarity with EAV (Entity-Attribute-Value) patterns in DB design


Prior work on AI/data-driven applications


Experience building embeddable or shareable components


Understanding of versioned user-generated data structures


Familiarity with job queues and background workers in Laravel


Example Database Schema You’ll Work With
We are using a semi-finalised schema with EAV patterns such as:
user_assets_version: Tracks asset versions


user_assets: Key-value store for user/AI-generated content


user_chat_log: Optional chat record table with user prompts and AI responses


Project Details
This is a fully remote, full-time contract role.


Estimated project length: 4 weeks


You will work closely with the product lead and a small design/dev team.


Daily standups and async communication in Basecamp/Slack.


Requirements
Minimum 3+ years commercial experience with Laravel


At least one shipped project using Livewire (V3)


Comfortable working independently and delivering to a sprint schedule


Excellent communication and attention to detail


Able to start immediately and commit full-time for the next month


How to Apply
Please send the following:
A short intro outlining your relevant experience


Links to your GitHub or portfolio


Availability (start date and any restrictions during the 4-week period)


Day rate

description:
We are looking for a freelancer to help us build a solution that can track how long a healthcare professional spends on specific patient-related pages (e.g., charts, details, or records) within EHR systems such as EPIC, Cerner, and Athenahealth.

Objective:
Capture and report time spent by a logged-in user while viewing a specific patient’s data.

This includes time spent on chart views, patient summary, or details page.

The solution should be able to send or store this data in a structured format to another system.

Key Requirements:
You should propose a method that can work across commonly used EHRs (such as EPIC, Athenahealth, Cerner, etc.).

The EHRs are accessed through standard web browsers.

Your solution should be able to:

Identify the user accessing the data

Detect when the user starts and ends interacting with a patient's record

Capture time duration of this interaction

Send the data to an external system (via API, webhook, or file)

It must respect data security and HIPAA compliance standards.

What You Should Include in Your Proposal:
Your proposed approach to solve this (at a high level — no need to reveal proprietary methods).

Have you done similar work or browser-based tracking for regulated platforms before? If yes, share details.

How long would it take you to deliver a working MVP?

What data will your solution be able to capture and how will it be transmitted?

Your cost estimate (hourly or fixed).

📌 Important Notes:

We are open to creative approaches — you do not need access to the EHR systems’ internal code.

The EHR interface is accessed by users via browser in a hosted environment, not self-hosted or fully customizable.

Only proposals with specific ideas and relevant experience will be considered.

description:
Job Overview
We're seeking an experienced Prompt Engineer with hands-on PromptLayer expertise to help optimize and scale our AI-powered features. You'll work directly with our founder and development team to implement robust prompt management, monitoring, and evaluation systems.
What You'll Do

Design and optimize prompts for our AI-powered data analysis and decision-making features
Create and manage golden datasets by manually tagging hundreds of data samples for evaluation purposes
Implement PromptLayer for prompt versioning, A/B testing, and performance monitoring against curated datasets
Set up evaluation pipelines to test prompt changes against golden datasets to prevent regression issues
Build observability dashboards to track LLM usage, costs, and performance metrics across different prompt versions
Collaborate with our non-technical team members to enable direct prompt editing through PromptLayer's visual interface
Establish systematic evaluation frameworks that catch edge cases and prevent prompt changes from breaking existing functionality

Required Experience

2+ years of prompt engineering experience with production LLM applications
Proven experience implementing and managing PromptLayer in real business environments
Strong background in creating evaluation datasets and golden datasets for prompt testing
Experience with regression testing methodologies to prevent prompt changes from breaking existing functionality
Strong understanding of LLM observability, logging, and performance optimization
Experience with OpenAI APIs, cost optimization, and usage analytics
Ability to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Background in data analysis or business intelligence tools (preferred)

Project Details
This is a 3-4 week project with potential for ongoing collaboration. We're looking for someone who can quickly audit our current AI implementations, help create and manage golden evaluation datasets, set up proper observability infrastructure, and train our team on best practices for prompt management and systematic testing against curated datasets.

Please include examples of PromptLayer implementations you've led (or similar), evaluation datasets you've created, and specific metrics on performance improvements you've achieved through systematic prompt testing.

description:
I’m looking to create a simple web-based tool for real estate agents. The tool will use OpenAI (GPT-4 or GPT-3.5 API) to generate professional property listing descriptions based on a few user inputs.

Here’s the basic flow:
   •   User uploads 1–3 property photos (optional feature if feasible)
   •   User enters:
      •   Property address (optional)
      •   Number of beds/baths
      •   Key property features (text field)
      •   Tone/style preference (dropdown: Luxury, Professional, Casual)
   •   Click “Generate Description”
   •   Output: AI-generated property listing description displayed on screen

Backend:
   •   OpenAI API (ChatGPT)
   •   Optional future feature: image reading for property photo input (basic now, but note if possible later)
   •   Subscription payment integration (Stripe preferred)

Frontend:
   •   Very simple, clean interface
   •   Mobile-friendly
   •   Basic branding (I’ll provide)

Ongoing potential work:
   •   Feedback loop integration (user rating system)
   •   Upsells: social media post generator, email follow-up tool

This project should be straightforward for any developer familiar with AI API integration and no-code/low-code tools (Bubble, Softr, or basic custom build). I’m looking for someone who can think like a user, not just a coder.

Please include:
   •   Relevant AI or API projects
   •   Estimated timeline and cost

This will be a long-term project if the tool gains traction.
